org.opendaylight.controller.config.api

Interface ConfigTransactionController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LookupRegistry, ServiceReferenceReadableRegistry, ServiceReferenceWritableRegistry
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConfigTransactionClient, ConfigTransactionControllerImplMXBean, ConfigTransactionControllerMXBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigTransactionJMXClient, TestingConfigTransactionController

    public interface ConfigTransactionController
extends LookupRegistry, ServiceReferenceWritableRegistry
    Represents functionality provided by configuration transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • createModule

        javax.management.ObjectName createModule(java.lang.String moduleName,
                                       java.lang.String instanceName)
                                         throws javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException
        Create new configuration bean.
        Parameters:
        moduleName -
        instanceName -
        Returns:
        ObjectName of newly created module
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException - if given ifcName and instanceName is already registered

      • destroyModule

        void destroyModule(javax.management.ObjectName objectName)
                   throws javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException
        Destroy existing module.
        Parameters:
        objectName - can be either read-only module name that can be obtained using LookupRegistry.lookupConfigBean(String, String) or writable module name that must contain current transaction name.
        Throws:
        javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException - if module is not found
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if object name contains wrong transaction name or domain

      • abortConfig

        void abortConfig()
        Destroy current transaction.

      • validateConfig

                    throws ValidationException
        This method can be called multiple times, has no side effects.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if validation fails

        transactionName

      • getAvailableModuleNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAvailableModuleNames()
        Returns:
        all known module factory names as reported by ModuleFactory.getImplementationName()
